Thank you Delwayne for your assistance but I still got the same response fr=
om Google along with the same links when I looked up Saijin Omoto and *Saij=
in Omoto* too like I did when I typed in Omoto-no-Saijin and Otomo-no-Saiji=
n as well but I again thank you for your response to my request. If its oka=
y with you can you enlighten me more on Omoto-no-Saijin based on your opini=
on and if possible could you see if there is anyone in your group that can =
also help me out as well. I do know so far from the links I found on him th=
at he was a strategist for Prince Shotoku Taishi but when looking for years=
 he was active and further information on him I can't find anything on him.=
 Other than the links I already have looked at in prior searches regarding =
Saijin Omoto. I can give you these same links that I found they primarily s=
ay the same thing about Omoto-no-Saijin but I would like an expert's opinio=
n on the links that I have looked at and if someone from your group with th=
eir expertise can help me out as well on this truly rare person in Japanese=
 history. It will be much appreciated because I think there were some samur=
ais that weren't that famous as other ones were and only were local lords i=
n their villages or retainers for their village. The links I found on Omoto=
-no Saijin are right here for everyone to look at just in case:
